statement.tex: %text Write the adjoint of the following matrix: % \left[\begin{array}{rr} 2 & -1 \\ 4 & 3 \end{array}\right]

step.context: %text If $A$ is a matrix whose cofactor matrix is $C$, and adjoint matrix is $A_{Adj}$, which of the following is true. %
step.reason: A_{Adj}=C^T \\ %text where $C^T$ represents the transpose of $C$, the cofactor matrix. %

step.context: \left[\begin{array}{rr} 2 & -1 \\ 4 & 3 \end{array}\right] \\ %text Is the following the cofactor matrix of the above matrix? %
step.reason: %text Cofactor Matrix $(C)$: If $c_{ij}$ is an element in the cofactor matrix $C$, it is represented by $c_{ij}=(-1)^{i+j}A_{ij}$, where $A_{ij}$ is the determinant of the matrix that results from deleting row $i$ and column $j$. %

step.context: C=\left[\begin{array}{rr} 3 & -4 \\ 1 & 2 \end{array}\right] \\ %text If $C$ is the cofactor matrix of given matrix A, what its adjoint? %
step.reason: %text $X^T$ or transpose of a matrix $X$ means converting all its rows into columns and its columns into rows. %
